result.execSummary:
The defendant Shuneka S Laymond Thornton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
AODA at the discretion of the Agent.
No contact with pharmacy's listed in the complaint.
No contact with any co-defendant's listed in the complaint.
Any valid prescription to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
No association with known drug users or drug dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Court finds if defendant completes probation  without any new criminal violations of law, court finds it is in the defendant's interest to expunge and society will not be harmed.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) LAST 10 days are STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion. Standard release conditions. COMMENCE 1/30/15 by 6pm.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shuneka S Laymond Thornton in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 12.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 13 and Ct. 14 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 12
- Sentence withheld for 2 years Probation - consecutive
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Court leaves absolute sobriety and AODA to the discretion of the Probation Agent. No contact with pharmacy's listed in the complaint. No contact with any co-defendant's listed in the complaint. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all RX.. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
-  35 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  commencing 01/30/2015 at 6:00 p.m..  LAST 10 DAYS ARE STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. 

Court addresses expunction.
Defense presents statements as to expunction.
State has no comment
Court finds if the defendant completes Probation sentence without any new criminal violations, the court finds it is in the defendant's interest to
expunge this and society will not be harmed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shuneka S Laymond Thornton in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests to schedule this matter for a plea/sentencing after the 1st of the year. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any codefendants, witnesses or pharmacies listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Shuneka S Laymond Thornton in court, in custody, with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Shuneka S Laymond Thornton not in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance by defendant or Attorney Tishberg, Court orders warrant to remain active.
Cash bail set at $4500 - signed by Judge Michael Bohren.
